Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw at least one land habitat (e.g., playground, garden, forest, parking lot) and one water habitat (e.g., pond, stream, lake).

The student can include drawings of different types of living things found in each habitat, such as trees, grasses, bushes, flowering plants in land habitats, and fish, clams, or plants in water habitats.
The student can illustrate plants and animals specific to each habitat to show diversity, such as lizards, squirrels, and ants for land habitats.
The student can demonstrate comparisons by showing the variety of living things in at least two different habitats.
The student can use patterns in their drawings to show how different habitats support different kinds of plants and animals.
